Account.description: Object represents user account in Callfire system

email.description: Email address associated with an account

firstName.description: First name of an account holder

id.description: An id of an account

lastName.description: Last name of an account holder

Account.title: Account

AddContactListContactsRequest.description: Request object for adding new contacts to an existing contact list

contactIds.description: A list of ids of existing contacts in Callfire system

contactNumbers.description: A phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Examples: 12132000384

contactNumbersField.description: A type of phone number (homePhone, workPhone, mobilePhone). This parameter works together with contactNumbers and specifies which types of numbers are included to a list

contacts.description: A list of new contact objects which need to be added

useCustomFields.description: A flag to indicate how to define property names for contacts. If true, uses the field and property names exactly as defined. If false will assign custom properties and fields to A, B, C, etc

AddContactListContactsRequest.title: AddContactListContactsRequest

AddDoNotContactRequest.description: Request object for adding new Do-Not-Contact records to account.

call.description: If set to true add all given numbers to Do-Not-Call list. Default value: true

numbers.description: A list of phone numbers in E.164 format (11-digit), example: 12132000384, 14142777322

source.description: A list of new contact objects which need to be added. Default value: Api V2

text.description: If set to true add all given numbers to Do-Not-Text list. Default value: true

AddDoNotContactRequest.title: AddDoNotContactRequest

ApiCredential.description: An object represents API user in CallFire system. Use /me/api/credentials endpoint to manage API users on your account

id.description: An id of an API credential

name.description: A name of an API credential

ApiCredential.title: ApiCredential

Batch.description: A batch represents a group of contacts which can be dialed or texted via call/text broadcast

broadcastId.description: An id of broadcast which batch belongs to

created.description: A date and time when batch was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

enabled.description: An enabled batch. If batch is disabled its contacts remain undialed/untexted

id.description: A id of a batch

remaining.description: A number of contacts remaining undialed/untexted

size.description: A total number of contacts in batch

status.description: A status of batch (NEW, VALIDATING, ERRORS, SOURCE_ERROR, ACTIVE). NEW - batch is queued for validation; VALIDATING - batch is currently validating; ERRORS - batch is processed, some validation errors occurred; SOURCE_ERROR - if contact source is contact list in Callfire system and it has an error; ACTIVE - batch is processed and ready

Batch.title: Batch

BatchRequest.description: Request object is used for adding new batch to an existing broadcast

contactListId.description: An id of existing contact list

recipients.description: A list of Recipient objects. For each recipient you can set its phone number or existing contact id to use contact which already exists in account

scrubDuplicates.description: Removes duplicate recipients from batch if true

BatchRequest.title: BatchRequest

BillingPlanUsage.description: Contains statistics of billing plan usage

intervalEnd.description: End of usage period formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

intervalStart.description: Start of usage period formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

remainingPayAsYouGoCredits.description: Remaining pay as you go credits are rounded to nearest whole value

remainingPlanCredits.description: Remaining credits are rounded to nearest whole value associated with a plan

totalRemainingCredits.description: Total number of remaining credits (remainingPlanCredits + remainingPayAsYouGoCredits)

BillingPlanUsage.title: BillingPlanUsage

Call.description: Represents a call action sent or received by Callfire platform

agentCall.description: An internal call to an agent

attributes.description: Map of user-defined string attributes associated with an action

batchId.description: An id of contact batch associated with an action

campaignId.description: An id of broadcast associated with an action if call is sent as part of call broadcast

contact.description: Existing contact in account, which was selected as a recipient for a given call

created.description: The time when the given resource was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

finalCallResult.description: Result of a call (LA, AM, BUSY, DNC, XFER, NO_ANS, XFER_LEG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED, SD, POSTPONED, ABANDONED, SKIPPED). See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

fromNumber.description: A sender's phone number in E.164 (11-digit) format

id.description: An id of  an action

labels.description: Labels associated with action or broadcast for this action

modified.description: The time when the given resource was modified, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

notes.description: Notes of call added by an agent

records.description: List of call records, each record contains call details like originate time, duration, cost, notes made by agents. A single contact may have a multiple phone numbers. In this case if given call was sent as a part of broadcast with configured retry logic then each call record will contain details about attempted phone number

state.description: State of an action (READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, DISABLED, FINISHED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT). See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

toNumber.description: A recipient's phone number in E.164 (11-digit) format

Call.title: Call

CallBroadcast.description: Call broadcast can be used to send out a voice message to a group of numbers. It supports IVR scripting, scheduling, retry logic, playing pre-recorded sounds, answering machine detection

answeringMachineConfig.description: Specifies which action should be taken if answering machine was detected, default value: AM_AND_LIVE. Available values: AM_ONLY - run AMD (Answering Machine Detection), hang up if LA (Live Answer); AM_AND_LIVE - run AMD, play separate live vs. machine sound; LIVE_WITH_AMD, run AMD, hang up if machine answers; LIVE_IMMEDIATE - no AMD, play live sound immediately

dialplanXml.description: IVR xml is a document which describes the dialplan to setup the IVR broadcast

fromNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) or short code for text. Example: 12132000384, 67076

id.description: A unique id of broadcast (readonly)

lastModified.description: The time when a given resource was updated, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

localTimeRestriction.description: Specifies a range of time during which Callfire will send a call or text to recipients. Please note that range of time applies to the recipient's timezone

maxActive.description: Sets a maximum number of calls to be dialed by Callfire at once

maxActiveTransfers.description: A maximum number of active transfers

recipients.description: Recipients of a call broadcast, can be either existing contacts or a new ones

resumeNextDay.description: If true resumes the unfinished campaign to the next day

retryConfig.description: Retry configuration allows system to retry the numbers which were not reached the first time. Designate the number of retries, the length between them, and which dispositions you want to retry

schedules.description: A list of schedule objects which specifies a range of time when broadcast should be started and stopped. Supports the scheduling per day of week

sounds.description: A set of sounds assigned to a voice broadcast to play depending on answering machine configuration

status.description: A status of a broadcast (read only). SETUP - campaign isn't configured yet; START_PENDING - waiting for contact batch population; RUNNING - campaign is running; STOPPED - campaign is stopped; FINISHED - campaign is finished; ARCHIVED - campaign was archived

CallBroadcast.title: CallBroadcast

CallBroadcastSounds.description: A set of sounds assigned to a voice broadcast to play according to an answering machine configuration. You can add the existing sounds from the account's sound library or to provide a text which will be converted into a speech. There are four sound options available for a Voice Broadcast campaign

dncDigit.description: Digit pressed to place contact in DNC list

dncSoundId.description: An id of sound file to play when recipient decided to opt out and pressed DNC digit

dncSoundText.description: Text to be turned into sound, plays to notify that Do Not Call digit has been pressed and inform your contact of their placement on the Do Not Call list

dncSoundTextVoice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1)

liveSoundId.description: An id of sound file to play if phone is answered

liveSoundText.description: Text to be used to turned into a sound. This text will be played when the phone is answered

liveSoundTextVoice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a live sound

machineSoundId.description: An id of a sound file to play if answering machine is detected

machineSoundText.description: Text to be turned into a sound. This text will be played when answering machine is detected

machineSoundTextVoice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1 , FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a machine sound

transferDigit.description: Digit pressed to initiate a transfer

transferNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) to transfer call to.  Example: 12132000384, 67076

transferSoundId.description: An id of a file to play if call is transferred

transferSoundText.description: Text to be turned into a sound. This text will be played when the transfer digit is played

transferSoundTextVoice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1) for a sound transfer

CallBroadcastSounds.title: CallBroadcastSounds

CallCreateSound.description: Request object is used for creating sound via a phone call. This sound will appear in account's sound library

name.description: Name of a sound to create

toNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 11-digit format to call to record a sound.  Example: 12132000384

CallCreateSound.title: CallCreateSound

CallRecipient.description: Recipient of a campaign action. Can be a phone number, contact, or contact list with attributes added to action. It is required to specify one of this values

attributes.description: Map of user-defined string attributes associated with recipient

contactId.description: An id of existing contact used as recipient

dialplanXml.description: An IVR xml document describing dialplan to setup an IVR broadcast. If dialplan is set there is no need to set live, machine and transfer sounds (or vice versa)

liveMessage.description: Text to be turned into a sound, this text will be played when the phone is answered

liveMessageSoundId.description: An id of a sound file to play if phone is answered

machineMessage.description: Text to be used to turn into sound, this text will be played when answering machine is detected

machineMessageSoundId.description: An id of a sound file to play if answering machine is detected

phoneNumber.description: Recipient's phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) or short code. Example: 12132000384

transferDigit.description: A digit pressed to initiate the transfer

transferMessage.description: Text to be turned into sound, this text will be played when the transfer digit is played

transferMessageSoundId.description: An id of a sound file to play if call is transferred

transferNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) to transfer the call to. Example: 12132000384

voice.description: The voice to be used (MALE1, FEMALE1, FEMALE2, SPANISH1, FRENCHCANADIAN1)

CallRecipient.title: CallRecipient

CallRecord.description: Represents a call sent to a contact's number

answerTime.description: Timestamp when call was answered, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

duration.description: Duration of the call in seconds

finishTime.description: Timestamp when call was finished, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

id.description: An id of a call record

labels.description: Labels associated with a call action

notes.description: Notes of call added by agent

originateTime.description: A date and time (timestamp) when call was originated by Callfire platform and went to downstream provider, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000

questionResponses.description: Notes of call added by an agent

recordings.description: A list of voice recordings of the call

toNumber.description: A phone number to which a call was addressed. Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit). Example: 12132000384

CallRecord.title: CallRecord

CallRecording.description: Represents a recording of a voice call

callId.description: An id of a call action

campaignId.description: Contains broadcast id if call was sent as a part of voice broadcast

created.description: The time when the given resource was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

hash.description: A unique string hash identifier of a recording

id.description: An id of a call recording

lengthInBytes.description: A size of a recording file in bytes

lengthInSeconds.description: Duration of a recording in seconds

mp3Url.description: A public URL of a call recording

state.description: Current state of a recording, available values: RECORDING - recording is in progress, READY - recording is ready, ERROR - error has occurred and recording can be broken

CallTrackingConfig.description: Call tracking configuration allows you track incoming calls, analyze, respond to customers using sms or voice replies. For more information see [call tracking page](https://www.callfire.com/products/call-tracking)

transferNumbers.description: List of phone numbers in E.164 format (11-digit) are used for transfer. Example: 12132000384

id.description: An id of a sound file

lengthInSeconds.description: Length of a sound in seconds

name.description: A name of a sound file

ContactList.description: Represents a contact list in CallFire system

name.description: A name of a contact list

TextAutoReply.description: CallFire allows you to set up auto reply messages for your numbers CallFire allows you to set up auto reply messages for your numbers and keywords. You can set a general auto reply for anyone who texts your number (keyword). Also you can include a text to match, so that the auto reply would be sent only to those recipients whose texts the matched text

Webhook.description: Webhook is a user-defined callback, which can be maintained via API. Callfire will send POST request to a client's endpoint defined in webhook once one of assigned events is triggered. See [webhooks guide](https://developers.callfire.com/webhooks-guide.html) for more information about CallFire Webhooks API.

callback.description: URL that webhook will send POST to on resource event trigger

createdAt.description: A time when the given resource was created, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000

enabled.description: A parameter which allows the webhook to send requests to unknown ssl endpoints (ssl certificate verification is disabled)

events.description: Comma separated list of events on resource that will trigger callbacks (ex: STARTED, STOPPED, FINISHED, etc...).

fields.description: A limit callback response to a particular fields

id.description: An id of a webhook

nonStrictSsl.description: A parameter which allows the webhook to send requests to unknown ssl endpoints (ssl certificate verification is disabled)

resource.description: A resource name that webhook is watching events on. Use GET /webhooks/resources to determine resources and events available (ex: InboundCall, OutboundCall, InboundText, OutboundText, CallBroadcast, TextBroadcast, etc...)

secret.description: Webhook secret token which is used as a signing key to HmacSHA1 hash of json payload which is returned in 'X-CallFire-Signature' header. This header can be used to verify callback POST is coming from CallFire. See [security guide](https://developers.callfire.com/security-guide.html)

singleUse.description: If true is set then webhook triggers only once. Afterwards the webhook will be deleted

updatedAt.description: A time when the given resource was updated, formatted in unix time milliseconds (read only). Example: 1473781817000

Webhook.title: Webhook

WebhookResource.description: WebhookResource describes a resource and a list of supported events, once event is triggered Callfire performs an HTTP POST request to a client's endpoint

resource.description: A name of a webhook resource (ex: InboundCall, OutboundCall, InboundText, OutboundText, CallBroadcast, TextBroadcast, etc...)

supportedEvents.description: A list of event names which are supported by webhook resource (ex: Started, Stopped, Finished, etc.)

WebhookResource.title: WebhookResource

actions.title: findCalls
actions.description: To search for all calls sent or received by the user. Use "id=0" for the campaignId parameter to query for all calls sent through the POST /calls API. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

fields.description: Limit fields received in response. E.g. fields: id, name or fields items (id, name), see more at [partial response](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#partial-response) page.

limit.description: To set the maximum number of records to return in a paged list response. The default is 100

offset.description: Offset to the start of a given page. The default is 0. Check [pagination](https://developers.callfire.com/docs.html#pagination) page for more information about pagination in CallFire API.

id.description: Lists the Call ids to search for. If calls ids are specified then other query parameters can be ignored

campaignId.description: An id of a campaign, queries for calls included to a particular campaign. Specify null for all campaigns and 0 for default campaign

batchId.description: An id of a contact batch, queries for calls of a particular contact batch

fromNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was from. Example: 12132000384

toNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format (11-digit) that call was sent to. Example: 12132000384

label.description: A label for a specific call

states.description: Searches for all calls which correspond to statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: READY, SELECTED, CALLBACK, FINISHED, DISABLED, DNC, DUP, INVALID, TIMEOUT, PERIOD_LIMIT. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

results.description: Searches for all calls with statuses listed in a comma separated string. Available values: SENT, RECEIVED, DNT, TOO_BIG, INTERNAL_ERROR, CARRIER_ERROR, CARRIER_TEMP_ERROR, UNDIALED. See [call states and results](https://developers.callfire.com/results-responses-errors.html)

inbound.description: Filters inbound calls for "true" value and outbound calls for "false" value

intervalBegin.description: Start of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

intervalEnd.description: End of the find time interval, formatted in unix time milliseconds. Example: 1473781817000 for Sat, 05 Jan 1985 14:03:37 GMT

actions.title: sendCalls

You can attach user-defined attributes to a Call action via CallRecipient.attributes property, attributes are available in Call action response

defaultMachineMessage.description: Text to be turned into a sound, this text will be played when answering machine is detected. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

defaultLiveMessageSoundId.description: Id of sound file to play if phone is answered. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

defaultMachineMessageSoundId.description: An id of a sound file to play if answering machine is detected. Parameter can be overridden for any particular CallRecipient

defaultVoice.description: The voice set by default for all text-to-speech messages defined in CallRecipient objects or as default *Message properties

actions.title: createContactList
actions.description: Creates a contact list for use with campaigns using 1 of 3 inputs. A List of Contact objects, a list of String E.164 numbers, or a list of CallFire contactIds can be used as the data source for the created contact list. After contact list is added into the CallFire system, contact lists goes through seven system safeguards that check the accuracy and consistency of the data. For example, our system checks that contact number is formatted correctly, is valid, is not duplicated in another contact list, or is not added on a specific DNC list. You can configure to keep/merge or remove contacts which do not complies these rules. If contacts were not added to a contact list after the validation, this means the data needs to be properly formatted and corrected before calling this API

actions.title: createWebhook
actions.description: Create a Webhook for notification in the CallFire system. Use the webhooks API to receive notifications of important CallFire events. Select the resource to listen to, and then choose the resource events to receive notifications on. When an event triggers, a POST will be made to the callback URL with a payload of notification information. Available resources and their events include 'CccCampaign': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'CallBroadcast': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'TextBroadcast': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'OutboundCall': ['finished'], 'InboundCall': ['finished'], 'OutboundText': ['finished'], 'InboundText': ['finished'], 'ContactList': ['validationFinished', 'validationFailed']. Webhooks support secret token which is used as signing key to HmacSHA1 hash of json payload which is returned in 'X-CallFire-Signature' header. This header can be used to verify callback POST is coming from CallFire. See [security guide](https://developers.callfire.com/security-guide.html)

actions.title: findWebhookResources
actions.description: Searches for webhook resources. Available resources include 'CccCampaign': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'CallBroadcast': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'TextBroadcast': ['started', 'stopped', 'finished'], 'OutboundCall': ['finished'], 'InboundCall': ['finished'], 'OutboundText': ['finished'], 'InboundText': ['finished'], 'ContactList': ['validationFinished', 'validationFailed']
